laboratory_examinations.findings: 5.2 mg/dL (normal range 9–11) at 3 weeks of age, 10.0 mg/dL at initial discharge, 7.0 mg/dL prior to PTH treatment at 14 months, 8.0 mg/dL after 17 months of PTH treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial levels were low (5.2 mg/dL), rose to 10.0 mg/dL, then dropped significantly to 7.0 mg/dL prior to PTH treatment, stabilizing at 8.0 mg/dL after treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 12.4 mg/dL (normal range 4.5–6.7) at 3 weeks of age.
1.2 mg/dL (normal range 1.6–2.3) at 3 weeks of age.
Less than 10 pg/mL (normal range 10–72) when serum calcium was 7.4 mg/dL.

Significantly elevated urine calcium:creatinine ratio (Not provided values) during hospitalization, 4.0 mg/mg when serum calcium was 7.4 mg/dL, 2.46 at initial discharge, 0.97–3.44 prior to PTH treatment, 0.18–1.18 after 17 months.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased over time, particularly after starting PTH, showing reduction from significantly elevated levels to within the normal range.
